SECRET.
WAR CABINET.
G. T. 2326
POSITION OF GENERAL DESSINO AS RUSSIAN MILITARY REPRESENTATIVE IN LONDON.
The Russian General Dessino called on me yesterday and handed me a document, of which the following is a translation. He asked that it might be circulated to the War Cabinet.
(Signed) M. P. A. Hankey.
2 Whitehall Gardens, S.W.
October 18th 1917.
No. 1531
London, 3rd September 1917.
Sir,
I have the honour to bring to your knowledge that, in pursuance of a communication from the Commander-in-Chief of the Russian Armies, Lieutenant-General Dessino representative of the Russian-Headquarters Staff, at British Headquarters is confirmed in his appointment by General Korniloff and as such, he is instructed to apply to the High Command and War Office of Great Britain on all matters connected with operations, administrative and military policy. He is also to be the medium for all communications that may have to be made on behalf of the Russian High Command.
When general meetings of the representatives of the Allied High Commands take place in England Lieutenant-General Dessino is instructed to be present to explain the views of the Russian High Command. He will in each instance receive the necessary instructions.
General, Korniloff is also of opinion that it is of great importance that General Dessino should be informed as far as possible and in good time of all operative, and politco-military questions conernining the British Army, as is done in the case of Allied representatives at Russian Headquarters.
Generals Zankevitch and Miller have received identical instructions to act as representatives of the Russian High Command in France and Ita1y respective1y.
With the highest consideration I have the honour to be etc., etc.,
(Signed) C. Nabokoff.
His Excellency The Rt. Hon.
Arthur James Balfour, &c., &c.,
